metadata.feature_description: Manages version control settings for both pages and files, allowing administrators to enable/disable versioning and set maximum version limits

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Disable page versioning and verify save

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Site Settings > Site Behavior > More tab
steps.actual: Versioning section visible with Enable Page Versioning toggle set to On

steps.action: Click the page versioning toggle to switch it Off
steps.expected: Toggle should switch to Off position
steps.actual: Toggle clicked and Save button enabled

steps.expected: Settings should save and show success message
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully with 'Settings have been updated.' message

steps.action: Navigate away and return to verify state persisted
steps.expected: Page versioning toggle should remain Off
steps.actual: Page versioning toggle confirmed as Off after returning to the page

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable page versioning and verify save

steps.action: Click the page versioning toggle to switch it On
steps.expected: Toggle should switch to On position
steps.actual: Toggle switched to On, Save button enabled

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set maximum page versions within valid range (1-20)

steps.action: Change Maximum Number of Page Versions Kept to 15
steps.expected: Value should be accepted without validation error
steps.actual: Value 15 entered successfully, no validation error shown

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set page versions outside valid range (validation error)

steps.action: Change Maximum Number of Page Versions Kept to 25 (outside valid range 1-20)
steps.expected: Validation error should appear indicating value is outside acceptable range
steps.actual: Red validation error indicator (exclamation mark) appeared next to the input field, indicating validation failure

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Disable file versioning and verify save

steps.action: Click the file versioning toggle to switch it Off
steps.expected: Toggle should switch to Off position
steps.actual: Toggle switched to Off, Save button enabled

steps.action: Click Save button and verify state
steps.expected: Settings should save and toggle should remain Off
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully, file versioning toggle confirmed as Off

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable file versioning and verify save

steps.action: Click the file versioning toggle to switch it On
steps.expected: Toggle should switch to On position
steps.actual: Toggle switched to On, Save button enabled

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set maximum file versions within valid range (5-25)

steps.action: Change Maximum Number of File Versions Kept to 20
steps.expected: Value should be accepted without validation error
steps.actual: Value 20 entered successfully, no validation error shown
Settings saved successfully with success message

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set file versions outside valid range (validation error)

steps.action: Change Maximum Number of File Versions Kept to 3 (below minimum of 5)
steps.expected: Validation error should appear indicating value is outside acceptable range
steps.actual: Red validation error indicator (exclamation mark) appeared next to the input field, indicating validation failure for value below minimum 5

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify changes persist after page refresh

steps.action: Set page versioning On with max 10, file versioning On with max 5, save and refresh page
steps.expected: All settings should persist after browser refresh
steps.actual: After refreshing the page and navigating back to Site Settings > Site Behavior > More, all values persisted correctly: Page Versioning On (10 max), File Versioning On (5 max)

observations: Validation uses client-side validation with red exclamation mark indicators. The validateRange function in the React component enforces page versions range of 1-20 and file versions range of 5-25.
The Save button remains disabled until changes are made, providing good UX feedback.
The RequireHost attribute on the API endpoints means only superuser/host accounts can access these settings.
Multi-portal support exists via the portalId parameter in the API, though this was not tested in this session.
